data.title: She-Hulk: Attorney at Law
data.overview: Jennifer Walters navigates the complicated life of a single, 30-something attorney who also happens to be a green 6-foot-7-inch superpowered Hulk.

episodes.title: A Normal Amount of Rage
episodes.overview: Jen Walters' world is turned upside down after a freak accident leaves her with superpowers.

episodes.title: Superhuman Law
episodes.overview: Jen is hired at a prestigious law firm but must practice as She-Hulk and rep a complicated client.

episodes.title: The People vs. Emil Blonsky
episodes.overview: She-Hulk represents Emil Blonsky aka The Abomination, but his parole hearing doesn't go as planned.

episodes.title: Is This Not Real Magic?
episodes.overview: She-Hulk's new client Wong is suing a magician for unauthorized use of the Mystic Arts.

episodes.title: Mean, Green, and Straight Poured into These Jeans
episodes.overview: She-Hulk discovers Titania owns the name She -Hulk and is suing her for trademark infringement.

episodes.title: Just Jen
episodes.overview: Jen is a bridesmaid in a friend's wedding, a stressful event compounded by uniquely She-Hulk issues.

episodes.title: The Retreat
episodes.overview: Jen visits Blonsky's wellness retreat, meets new friends and gets in touch with her inner She-Hulk.

episodes.title: Ribbit and Rip It
episodes.overview: She-Hulk represents Leap-Frog who was injured due to a malfunction in his custom-made super suit.

episodes.title: Whose Show Is This?
episodes.overview: Jen finds herself in trouble with the law and struggles to pick up the pieces of her life.

data.title: Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness
data.overview: Doctor Strange teams up with a mysterious teenage girl from his dreams who can travel across multiverses, to battle multiple threats, including other-universe versions of himself, which threaten to wipe out millions across the multiverse. They seek help from Wanda the Scarlet Witch, Wong and others.

data.title: Thor: Love and Thunder
data.overview: Thor enlists the help of Valkyrie, Korg and ex-girlfriend Jane Foster to fight Gorr the God Butcher, who intends to make the gods extinct.

data.title: Ms. Marvel
data.overview: Kamala is a superhero fan with an imagination, particularly when it comes to Captain Marvel; Kamala feels like she doesn't fit in at school and sometimes even at home, that is until she gets superpowers like the heroes she's looked up to.

episodes.title: Generation Why
episodes.overview: Kamala Khan attends Avengercon only to discover that she herself might have superpowers.

episodes.title: Crushed
episodes.overview: Kamala and Bruno explore the source of her newfound powers just in time for a perilous adventure.

episodes.title: Destined
episodes.overview: Ahead of Aamir's wedding, Kamala may face grave consequences due to a crucial decision she makes.

episodes.title: Seeing Red
episodes.overview: Kamala travels around the world to solve the mystery of the bangle and her family's history.

episodes.title: Time and Again
episodes.overview: The bangle reveals to Kamala secrets about her family lineage, as well as the truth behind the Veil.

episodes.title: No Normal
episodes.overview: Back in Jersey, Kamala finds Kamran and protects him from Damage Control who will stop at nothing to take him in.

data.title: Spider-Man: No Way Home
data.overview: With Spider-Man's identity now revealed, Peter asks Doctor Strange for help. When a spell goes wrong, dangerous foes from other worlds start to appear, forcing Peter to discover what it truly means to be Spider-Man.

data.title: Iron Man
data.overview: After being held captive in an Afghan cave, billionaire engineer Tony Stark creates a unique weaponized suit of armor to fight evil.

data.title: The Incredible Hulk
data.overview: Bruce Banner, a scientist on the run from the U.S. Government, must find a cure for the monster he turns into whenever he loses his temper.

data.title: Iron Man 2
data.overview: With the world now aware of his identity as Iron Man, Tony Stark must contend with both his declining health and a vengeful mad man with ties to his father's legacy.

data.title: Thor
data.overview: The powerful but arrogant god Thor is cast out of Asgard to live amongst humans in Midgard (Earth), where he soon becomes one of their finest defenders.

data.title: Captain America: The First Avenger
data.overview: Steve Rogers, a rejected military soldier, transforms into Captain America after taking a dose of a Super-Soldier serum. But being Captain America comes at a price as he attempts to take down a war monger and a terrorist organization.

data.title: The Avengers
data.overview: Earth's mightiest heroes must come together and learn to fight as a team if they are going to stop the mischievous Loki and his alien army from enslaving humanity.

data.title: Iron Man 3
data.overview: When Tony Stark's world is torn apart by a formidable terrorist called the Mandarin, he starts an odyssey of rebuilding and retribution.

data.title: Thor: The Dark World
data.overview: When the Dark Elves attempt to plunge the universe into darkness, Thor must embark on a perilous and personal journey that will reunite him with doctor Jane Foster.

data.title: Captain America: The Winter Soldier
data.overview: As Steve Rogers struggles to embrace his role in the modern world, he teams up with a fellow Avenger and S.H.I.E.L.D agent, Black Widow, to battle a new threat from history: an assassin known as the Winter Soldier.

data.title: Guardians of the Galaxy
data.overview: A group of intergalactic criminals must pull together to stop a fanatical warrior with plans to purge the universe.

data.title: Avengers: Age of Ultron
data.overview: When Tony Stark and Bruce Banner try to jump-start a dormant peacekeeping program called Ultron, things go horribly wrong and it's up to Earth's mightiest heroes to stop the villainous Ultron from enacting his terrible plan.

data.title: Ant-Man
data.overview: Armed with a super-suit with the astonishing ability to shrink in scale but increase in strength, cat burglar Scott Lang must embrace his inner hero and help his mentor, Dr. Hank Pym, pull off a plan that will save the world.

data.title: Captain America: Civil War
data.overview: Political involvement in the Avengers' affairs causes a rift between Captain America and Iron Man.

data.title: Doctor Strange
data.overview: While on a journey of physical and spiritual healing, a brilliant neurosurgeon is drawn into the world of the mystic arts.

data.title: Guardians of the Galaxy: Vol. 2
data.overview: The Guardians struggle to keep together as a team while dealing with their personal family issues, notably Star-Lord's encounter with his father the ambitious celestial being Ego.

data.title: Thor: Ragnarok
data.overview: Imprisoned on the planet Sakaar, Thor must race against time to return to Asgard and stop Ragnarök, the destruction of his world, at the hands of the powerful and ruthless villain Hela.

data.title: Black Panther
data.overview: T'Challa, heir to the hidden but advanced kingdom of Wakanda, must step forward to lead his people into a new future and must confront a challenger from his country's past.

data.title: Avengers: Infinity War
data.overview: The Avengers and their allies must be willing to sacrifice all in an attempt to defeat the powerful Thanos before his blitz of devastation and ruin puts an end to the universe.

data.title: Ant-Man and the Wasp
data.overview: As Scott Lang balances being both a superhero and a father, Hope van Dyne and Dr. Hank Pym present an urgent new mission that finds the Ant-Man fighting alongside The Wasp to uncover secrets from their past.

data.title: Captain Marvel
data.overview: Carol Danvers becomes one of the universe's most powerful heroes when Earth is caught in the middle of a galactic war between two alien races.

data.title: Avengers: Endgame
data.overview: After the devastating events of Avengers: Infinity War (2018), the universe is in ruins. With the help of remaining allies, the Avengers assemble once more in order to reverse Thanos' actions and restore balance to the universe.

data.title: Black Widow
data.overview: Natasha Romanoff confronts the darker parts of her ledger when a dangerous conspiracy with ties to her past arises.

data.title: Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings
data.overview: Shang-Chi, the master of weaponry-based Kung Fu, is forced to confront his past after being drawn into the Ten Rings organization.

data.title: Eternals
data.overview: The saga of the Eternals, a race of immortal beings who lived on Earth and shaped its history and civilizations.

data.title: Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness
data.overview: Doctor Strange teams up with a mysterious teenage girl from his dreams who can travel across multiverses, to battle multiple threats, including other-universe versions of himself, which threaten to wipe out millions across the multiverse. They seek help from Wanda the Scarlet Witch, Wong and others.

data.title: Thor: Love and Thunder
data.overview: Thor enlists the help of Valkyrie, Korg and ex-girlfriend Jane Foster to fight Gorr the God Butcher, who intends to make the gods extinct.

data.title: Black Panther: Wakanda Forever
data.overview: The nation of Wakanda is pitted against intervening world powers as they mourn the loss of their king T'Challa.

data.title: WandaVision
data.overview: Blends the style of classic sitcoms with the MCU, in which Wanda Maximoff and Vision - two super-powered beings living their ideal suburban lives - begin to suspect that everything is not as it seems.

episodes.title: Filmed Before a Live Studio Audience
episodes.overview: Wanda and Vision struggle to conceal their powers during dinner with Vision's boss and his wife.

episodes.title: Don't Touch That Dial
episodes.overview: In an effort to fit in, Wanda and Vision perform a magic act in their community talent show.

episodes.title: Now in Color
episodes.overview: Wanda's pregnancy fritzes her powers as she and Vision prepare for an accelerated delivery.

episodes.title: We Interrupt This Program
episodes.overview: Monica Rambeau, tasked with a special assignment regarding sentient weapons, goes missing.

episodes.title: On a Very Special Episode...
episodes.overview: Wanda addresses Vision's worries when he grows suspicious of the neighbors' strange behaviour.

episodes.title: All-New Halloween Spooktacular!
episodes.overview: Disturbances on Halloween separate Wanda from Vision, who looks into anomalous activity in Westview.

episodes.title: Breaking the Fourth Wall
episodes.overview: Monica plots her return, Wanda navigates unsettling complications, and Vision forms a new alliance.

episodes.title: Previously On
episodes.overview: Wanda embarks on a troubling journey revisiting her past for insight into her present and future.

episodes.title: The Series Finale
episodes.overview: Wanda battles Agatha and Vision fights his S.W.O.R.D. counterpart as Hayward launches an attack on Westview.

data.title: The Falcon and the Winter Soldier
data.overview: Following the events of 'Avengers: Endgame,' Sam Wilson/Falcon and Bucky Barnes/Winter Soldier team up in a global adventure that tests their abilities -- and their patience.

episodes.title: New World Order
episodes.overview: Sam Wilson and Bucky Barnes realize that their futures are anything but normal.

episodes.title: The Star-Spangled Man
episodes.overview: John Walker is named Captain America, and Sam Wilson and Bucky Barnes team up against the rebel group the Flag Smashers.

episodes.title: Power Broker
episodes.overview: To find the source of the Super Soldier Serum, Sam and Bucky must scale a ladder of low-lifes starting in Madripoor with Zemo.

episodes.title: The Whole World Is Watching
episodes.overview: John Walker loses patience with Sam and Bucky as they learn more about Karli Morgenthau.

episodes.title: Truth
episodes.overview: Sam Wilson, Bucky Barnes, Baron Zemo, John Walker, and Karli Morgenthau must all deal with the fall out from their actions.

episodes.title: One World, One People
episodes.overview: As the Flag Smashers escalate their efforts, Sam and Bucky take action.

data.title: Loki
data.overview: The mercurial villain Loki resumes his role as the God of Mischief in a new series that takes place after the events of “Avengers: Endgame.”

episodes.title: Glorious Purpose
episodes.overview: Loki, the God of Mischief, finds himself out of time and in an unusual place and forced - against his godly disposition - to cooperate with others.

episodes.title: The Variant
episodes.overview: Mobius puts Loki to work, but not everyone at TVA is thrilled about the God of Mischief's presence.

episodes.title: Lamentis
episodes.overview: Loki finds out The Variant's plan, but he has his own that will forever alter both their destinies.

episodes.title: The Nexus Event
episodes.overview: Frayed nerves and paranoia infiltrate the TVA as Mobius and Hunter B-15 search for Loki and Sylvie.

episodes.title: Journey Into Mystery
episodes.overview: Loki tries to escape The Void, a desolate purgatory where he meets variant versions of himself.

episodes.title: For All Time. Always.
episodes.overview: The clock is ticking in the season finale which finds Loki and Sylvie on a date with destiny.

data.title: What If
data.overview: Exploring pivotal moments from the Marvel Cinematic Universe and turning them on their head, leading the audience into uncharted territory.

episodes.title: What If... Captain Carter Were the First Avenger?
episodes.overview: When Steve Rogers is seriously injured, Peggy Carter becomes the world's first super soldier.

episodes.title: What If... T'Challa Became a Star-Lord?
episodes.overview: The rough-and-tumble space pirates known as the Ravagers abduct T'Challa instead of Peter Quill.

episodes.title: What If... The World Lost Its Mightiest Heroes?
episodes.overview: Nick Fury struggles to launch The Avengers when candidates are targeted by a serial killer.

episodes.title: What If... Doctor Strange Lost His Heart Instead of His Hands?
episodes.overview: A grief-stricken Doctor Strange uses the Eye of Agamotto in a dangerous effort to change the past.

episodes.title: What If... Zombies?!
episodes.overview: When The Avengers are infected by a zombie plague, surviving heroes search for a cure.

episodes.title: What If... Killmonger Rescued Tony Stark?
episodes.overview: Killmonger rescues Tony Stark when his Humvee is attacked in Afghanistan and manipulates his influence for his designs of conquering Wakanda.

episodes.title: What If... Thor Were an Only Child?
episodes.overview: Thor, who never learned to be a good hero, throws an out-of-control intergalactic party on Earth.

episodes.title: What If... Ultron Won?
episodes.overview: Natasha Romanoff and Clint Barton seek to destroy killer-robot Ultron following a cataclysmic event.

episodes.title: What If... The Watcher Broke His Oath?
episodes.overview: The Watcher gathers heroes from across the multiverse for one final battle against Infinity Ultron.

data.title: Hawkeye
data.overview: Series based on the Marvel Comics superhero Hawkeye, centering on the adventures of Young Avenger, Kate Bishop, who took on the role after the original Avenger, Clint Barton.”

episodes.title: Never Meet Your Heroes
episodes.overview: Archer Kate Bishop lands in the middle of a criminal conspiracy, forcing Hawkeye out of retirement.

episodes.title: Hide and Seek
episodes.overview: Clint has to help Kate disentangle herself from the Tracksuit Mafia and a real-life murder mystery.

episodes.title: Echoes
episodes.overview: After escaping a new threat, Clint and Kate join forces against an expanding criminal conspiracy.

episodes.title: Partners, Am I Right?
episodes.overview: Secrets are revealed and hard truths emerge, culminating in a battle against two opposing forces.

episodes.title: Ronin
episodes.overview: A fallout nearly derails their partnership, but Kate makes a discovery that changes everything.

episodes.title: So This Is Christmas?
episodes.overview: Clint and Kate's partnership is tested as they face the consequences of exposing the conspiracy.

data.title: Daredevil
data.overview: A blind lawyer by day, vigilante by night. Matt Murdock fights the crime of New York as Daredevil.”

episodes.title: Into the Ring
episodes.overview: Matt Murdock and Foggy Nelson open their law firm, and take the case of a woman accused of murder who Matt believes is innocent.

episodes.title: Cut Man
episodes.overview: Murdock makes a near fatal error while trying to save a kidnapped boy, and finds an unlikely ally when he needs saving himself.

episodes.title: Rabbit in a Snowstorm
episodes.overview: Murdock and Foggy take on a mysterious wealthy client, but Murdock is convinced that there's more to the case than just the facts.

episodes.title: In the Blood
episodes.overview: Two vicious Russian brothers working for Fisk strike back against Daredevil. Fisk moves to further consolidate his power in the criminal underworld.

episodes.title: World on Fire
episodes.overview: Fisk moves forward with plans that threaten to rip Hell's Kitchen apart. Murdock and Foggy take on a case helping tenants victimised by a slumlord.

episodes.title: Condemned
episodes.overview: Daredevil finds himself trapped in the fallout of Fisk's plan to take control of Hell's Kitchen. Ben Urich digs closer to the truth.

episodes.title: Stick
episodes.overview: An important figure from Murdock's past reemerges seeking his help to battle a new enemy threatening Hell's Kitchen.

episodes.title: Shadows in the Glass
episodes.overview: While Murdock, Foggy and Karen's mission becomes clearer, Fisk's world spins further out of control in his battle for Hell's Kitchen.

episodes.title: Speak of the Devil
episodes.overview: When Fisk gains the upper hand, the goal to destroy him becomes even more difficult, while Daredevil faces his own demons.

episodes.title: Nelson v. Murdock
episodes.overview: After Foggy and Murdock's relationship has taken a turn for the worst, a new enemy of Fisk has surfaced.

episodes.title: The Path of the Righteous
episodes.overview: Fisk and Murdock wrestle with the consequences of their chosen paths while Ben and Karen get closer to Fisk's true past.

episodes.title: The Ones We Leave Behind
episodes.overview: Fisk seeks revenge while Karen is haunted by recent events. Daredevil makes a startling discovery about Fisk's financing.

episodes.title: Daredevil
episodes.overview: In the season finale, a boxed-in Fisk and a desperate Murdock, Foggy, and Karen are forced to play their end games.

episodes.title: Bang
episodes.overview: In the void left by Fisk's removal, a new threat to Hell's Kitchen emerges. Murdock and Foggy take on a client with a questionable past.

episodes.title: Dogs to a Gunfight
episodes.overview: As Murdock recovers from an attack, Foggy and Karen fight to protect their new client from both the law and the Kitchen's newest vigilante.

episodes.title: New York's Finest
episodes.overview: Trapped face-to-face with the Punisher, Daredevil wrestles with the morality of vigilante justice. Meanwhile, Foggy and Karen work to save the firm..

episodes.title: Penny and Dime
episodes.overview: Karen uncovers shocking facts about the Punisher, who finds himself hunted by a powerful force in Hell's Kitchen. Daredevil ponders his next moves.

episodes.title: Kinbaku
episodes.overview: A former lover arrives in Hell's Kitchen and turns Murdock's world upside down. Karen digs for the truth about the Punisher.

episodes.title: Regrets Only
episodes.overview: A lethal foe returns with a vengeance, Foggy and Murdock risk the firm to ensure justice, and Karen sees a different side of the Punisher.

episodes.title: Semper Fidelis
episodes.overview: Murdock and Foggy take on the DA in the trial of the century, but their client refuses to play along. Murdock struggles to balance his dual identities.

episodes.title: Guilty as Sin
episodes.overview: As the firm's trial spins out of control, a figure from Murdock's past returns to deliver shocking revelations about the future of Hell's Kitchen.

episodes.title: Seven Minutes in Heaven
episodes.overview: Castle gets an offer he can't refuse. Foggy and Murdock question the future of their firm, but Karen won't give up so easily.

episodes.title: The Man in the Box
episodes.overview: Murdock and Foggy get caught in the crossfire of the Punisher's revenge. Karen and Murdock dig for the truth in very different ways.

Karen starts working with Frank to bring the mysterious Blacksmith down. Claire quits her job as the hospital's administration are trying to keep her silent. Matt visits Madame Gao to get information on Blacksmith.

episodes.title: The Dark at the End of the Tunnel
episodes.overview: Daredevil goes underground to save an old friend. Karen follows a dangerous lead. The law firm of Nelson and Murdock may have reached its final chapter.

episodes.title: A Cold Day in Hell's Kitchen
episodes.overview: In the season finale Daredevil is backed into the ultimate showdown for his own life  and the future of Hell's Kitchen.

episodes.title: Resurrection
episodes.overview: Shattered physically and spiritually, Matt rethinks his purpose and place in Hell's Kitchen. Meanwhile, Fisk puts a plan in motion from behind bars.

episodes.title: Please
episodes.overview: Grieving for the life he's abandoned, Matt suffers a crisis of faith. Fisk makes a deal with the FBI that turns him into a target.

episodes.title: No Good Deed
episodes.overview: As Fisk moves into swanky new digs amid a public outcry, Matt wrestles with how far he's ready to go to right this wrong. Dex's aim comes into focus.

episodes.title: Blindsided
episodes.overview: While Matt infiltrates a prison to find information on the Albanians, Fisk puts Dex in his crosshairs and a fed-up Foggy goes on the offensive.

episodes.title: The Perfect Game
episodes.overview: To quell the rising backlash over his release, Fisk serves up a scapegoat to the FBI. Dex misses the mark when he runs into a woman from his past.

episodes.title: The Devil You Know
episodes.overview: Driven to the edge, Dex loses his way until he's offered a lifeline by Fisk. Matt comes to Karen for help, which she agrees to give -- on one condition.

episodes.title: Aftermath
episodes.overview: The press crucifies Daredevil after the attack on the Bulletin, and Agent Nadeem suspects the FBI paid too high a price for Fisk's cooperation.

episodes.title: Upstairs/Downstairs
episodes.overview: A desperate Dex reaches out for help, Matt forms an uneasy alliance with Agent Nadeem, and Karen concocts a dangerous plan to provoke Fisk.

episodes.title: Revelations
episodes.overview: Matt's already shaky world tilts when he learns a shocking truth. Karen runs for her life. Nadeem discovers how deep Fisk's influence runs.

episodes.title: Karen
episodes.overview: Hunted by Fisk and haunted by mistakes from her past, Karen seeks refuge at the church. Matt finally gets his shot, and Dex goes in for the kill.

episodes.title: Reunion
episodes.overview: Dex tries to run his prey to ground, Nadeem's conscience kicks in, and Fisk looks to recover a gift from Vanessa seized during his incarceration.

episodes.title: One Last Shot
episodes.overview: Fisk's long-awaited reunion doesn't go as planned. Nelson & Murdock take on a new client who holds key information on Kingpin.

episodes.title: A New Napkin
episodes.overview: Matt prepares to cross the line, as Dex becomes more dangerous than ever and Fisk enacts his endgame.

data.title: Jessica Jones
data.overview: Following the tragic end of her brief superhero career, Jessica Jones tries to rebuild her life as a private investigator, dealing with cases involving people with remarkable abilities in New York City.

episodes.title: AKA Ladies Night
episodes.overview: Jessica Jones is hired to find an NYU student athlete who's vanished, but it turns out to be more than a simple missing persons case.

episodes.title: AKA Crush Syndrome
episodes.overview: Jessica vows to prove Hope's innocence, even though it means tracking down a terrifying figure from her own past.

episodes.title: AKA It's Called Whiskey
episodes.overview: It won't be easy to acquire or deploy but Jessica thinks she's found a weapon to use against Kilgrave. Luke and Jessica bond over their similarities.

episodes.title: AKA 99 Friends
episodes.overview: A new case demands attention as Jessica tries to find out who's spying on her for Kilgrave. Trish's radio show yields unexpected consequences.

episodes.title: AKA The Sandwich Saved Me
episodes.overview: Despite Jessica's objections, Trish's new friend Simpson gets involved in the hunt for Kilgrave. Jessica recalls a pivotal moment in her life.

episodes.title: AKA You're a Winner!
episodes.overview: Luke hires Jessica to help him find someone who may have skipped town, but she fears he'll learn too much about her history in the process.

episodes.title: AKA Top Shelf Perverts
episodes.overview: Malcom, Simpson and Trish go rogue to prevent Jessica from carrying out an extreme plan to outwit Kilgrave.

episodes.title: AKA WWJD?
episodes.overview: Jessica experiences a strange homecoming courtesy of Kilgrave. Hogarth's conflict with her estranged wife reaches a tipping point..

episodes.title: AKA Sin Bin
episodes.overview: Just when Jessica has Kilgrave right where she wants him, Hogarth's involvement complicates the situation. Details of Kilgrave's past emerge.

episodes.title: AKA 1,000 Cuts
episodes.overview: A discovery has the potential to change the entire game -- if Jessica can refuse Kilgrave's offer.

episodes.title: AKA I've Got the Blues
episodes.overview: Jessica searches morgues for clues. Trish goes all out to keep Simpson from getting in Jessica's way. Malcolm has an epiphany.

episodes.title: AKA Take a Bloody Number
episodes.overview: The hunt for Kilgrave reunites Jessica with Luke. Trish receives some unexpected information about Simpson and Jessica.

episodes.title: AKA Smile
episodes.overview: Jessica and Luke get help from someone else in the neighborhood. Kilgrave gears up for a major test of powers against Jessica.

episodes.title: AKA Start at the Beginning
episodes.overview: While Jessica deals with a rival PI and a paranoid would-be client, Trish digs up a medical file that could unlock the mystery of Jessica's powers.

episodes.title: AKA Freak Accident
episodes.overview: Jessica sets out to find Dr. Kozlov and makes a startling discovery. Trish recruits Malcolm for backup as she visits a figure from her past.

episodes.title: AKA Sole Survivor
episodes.overview: As her visions intensify, Jessica visits an abandoned clinic, where she stumbles on a new lead. Jeri faces an ultimatum after her secret gets out.

episodes.title: AKA God Help the Hobo
episodes.overview: Between anger management classes and tabloid scandals, Jessica and Trish track down a third patient linked to IGH. Oscar extends an olive branch.

episodes.title: AKA The Octopus
episodes.overview: Backed into a corner, Jessica's forced to share her intel on the killer. A groggy Trish tries to pull herself together before an important meeting.

episodes.title: AKA Facetime
episodes.overview: Jessica gate-crashes an exclusive country club on the hunt for the killer, and Trish's new addiction begins to spiral out of control.

episodes.title: AKA I Want Your Cray Cray
episodes.overview: Flashbacks shed new light on the aftermath of the family's car accident and reveal a painful turning point in Jessica's adult life.

episodes.title: AKA Ain't We Got Fun
episodes.overview: While Jessica debates her next move, Malcolm confronts Trish about her erratic behavior, and Jeri makes contact with a healer.

episodes.title: AKA Shark in the Bathtub, Monster in the Bed
episodes.overview: The shooting forces Jessica to rethink her plans. Meanwhile, Oscar asks for help with a family crisis, and Trish's frustrations finally boil over.

episodes.title: AKA Pork Chop
episodes.overview: Jeri finagles a deal for her new client in exchange for Karl's location. Trish forges ahead with her own investigation. A prison guard crosses a line.

episodes.title: AKA Three Lives and Counting
episodes.overview: Shocked by her own actions and haunted by visions of Kilgrave, Jessica worries she's turning into a monster. Trish's plans for Karl become clear.

episodes.title: AKA Pray for My Patsy
episodes.overview: As Jessica and Dorothy wait anxiously for updates on Trish, a call from Costa brings alarming news. Jeri hatches a plan to get her revenge.

episodes.title: AKA Playland
episodes.overview: Waking up in unfamiliar surroundings, Jessica once again finds herself torn between two worlds and facing an impossible choice.

episodes.title: A.K.A The Perfect Burger
episodes.overview: As Jessica focuses on helping the helpless, Dorothy Walker shows up at Alias to beg for help finding a missing Trish.

episodes.title: A.K.A You're Welcome
episodes.overview: Tensions run high between Jessica and Trish as Trish hones her new catlike skills and scours the city for a chance to be a hero.

episodes.title: A.K.A I Have No Spleen
episodes.overview: Itching to get back out on the streets and find her attacker, Jessica defies her doctor's advice. Jeri reconnects with her college flame Kith.

episodes.title: A.K.A Customer Service is Standing By
episodes.overview: Jessica learns there's more to Erik than meets the eye as they track down three potential attackers. Malcolm digs up dirt on Kith's husband.

episodes.title: A.K.A I Wish
episodes.overview: Teaming up with Trish to stake out Sallinger, Jessica makes a startling discovery. Jeri's plot to expose Peter yields unexpected consequences.

episodes.title: A.K.A Sorry Face
episodes.overview: As the police sift through the gruesome crime scene, Jessica and Trish race to find Sallinger's latest captive.

episodes.title: A.K.A The Double Half-Wappinger
episodes.overview: Jessica and Trish go on a road trip to dig into Sallinger's past and unearth a horrifying discovery.

episodes.title: A.K.A Camera Friendly
episodes.overview: When Sallinger posts a video teasing his next crime, Jessica responds with her own media play. Jeri demands that Malcolm identify the masked woman.

episodes.title: A.K.A I Did Something Today
episodes.overview: After a shocking blow, Jessica's forced to choose between protecting Trish and destroying Sallinger. Jeri seizes a chance to get back in Kith's life.

episodes.title: A.K.A Hero Pants
episodes.overview: Jessica wrestles with her emotions as she tries to untangle herself from a murder investigation.

episodes.title: A.K.A Hellcat
episodes.overview: Trish revisits her troubled childhood with Dorothy while plotting to stop Sallinger and stamp out evil across the city.

episodes.title: A.K.A A Lotta Worms
episodes.overview: As Trish makes a move on Sallinger, Jessica intervenes -- and ends up caught in a harrowing dance with the killer..

episodes.title: A.K.A Everything
episodes.overview: An old friend visits Jessica as she sets out on an agonizing mission and learns the true cost of being a hero.

data.title: Luke Cage
data.overview: When a sabotaged experiment gives him super strength and unbreakable skin, Luke Cage becomes a fugitive attempting to rebuild his life in Harlem and must soon confront his past and fight a battle for the heart of his city.

episodes.title: Moment of Truth
episodes.overview: With tension building in the streets of Harlem thanks to ruthless club owner Cottonmouth, Luke finds it increasingly difficult to live a quiet life.

episodes.title: Code of the Streets
episodes.overview: Luke is pulled deeper into the fight for his neighborhood when, as a favor to an old friend, he tries to help a kid who's in trouble with Cottonmouth.

episodes.title: Who's Gonna Take the Weight?
episodes.overview: In the aftermath of a chaotic event at a favorite Harlem hangout, Luke heeds the call to action and hits Cottonmouth where he'll feel it most.

episodes.title: Step in the Arena
episodes.overview: As he rescues a victim of Cottonmouth's vengeance, Luke remembers his earlier life and the conspiracy that led to his superhuman strength.

episodes.title: Just to Get a Rep
episodes.overview: Cottonmouth strikes back at Luke by taking his vengeance out on the people of Harlem, while detective Knight and Scarfe face an unexpected threat.

episodes.title: Suckas Need Bodyguards
episodes.overview: https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/marvelcinematicuniverse/images/e/e8/Suckas_Needs_Bodyguards.PNG/revision/latest?cb=20161012140015
episodes.poster: After Cottonmouth and Scarfe's bloody clash, Luke realizes that saving the community may turn former allies into enemies, and enemies into allies.

episodes.title: Manifest
episodes.overview: Mariah's political career comes under fire, and Cottonmouth picks up information that could put Luke on the run.

episodes.title: Blowin' Up the Spot
episodes.overview: Mariah campaigns to turn the city and the police against Luke, and not even Misty or Claire may be able to save him.

episodes.title: DWYCK
episodes.overview: With Luke wounded and on the run, Misty faces a soul-searching interrogation. Mariah's rise to power takes a dark turn.

episodes.title: Take It Personal
episodes.overview: Luke gets closer to the truth about Reva and her part in his fate, while Mariah wrestles with the morality of her new role. Misty hunts for Luke.

episodes.title: Now You're Mine
episodes.overview: In one bold move, a person from Luke's past puts Luke on the defensive, Misty in dire straits, and Harlem's safety in jeopardy.

episodes.title: Soliloquy of Chaos
episodes.overview: Misty digs deeper for the truth as the neighbourhood's power players throw the city into confusion.

episodes.title: You Know My Steez
episodes.overview: With all of Harlem bearing witness, Luke takes on the fight of his life in hopes of emerging as the defender his city needs.

episodes.title: Soul Brother #1
episodes.overview: As Luke adjusts to his growing fame and tries to shut down the flow of heroin branded with his name, someone from his past reaches out.

episodes.title: Straighten It Out
episodes.overview: Luke tests out his abilities on the ballfield, Misty ruffles feathers at the precinct, and Mariah plans a reunion to boost her image.

episodes.title: Wig Out
episodes.overview: Worried Luke is heading down a dark path, Claire pays a visit to his father. Bushmaster makes a bid for Mariah's guns.

episodes.title: I Get Physical
episodes.overview: As footage of his fight with Bushmaster goes viral, Luke struggles with the aftereffects and follows a trail of clues to Tilda's shop.

episodes.title: All Souled Out
episodes.overview: Desperate to drum up quick cash for a lawsuit, Luke weighs an offer from a superfan. Mariah invites Tilda to join the new family business.

episodes.title: The Basement
episodes.overview: As a wave of violence rocks Harlem, everyone races to connect the dots between Piranha, Mariah, Bushmaster and the grisly find at the clinic.

episodes.title: On and On
episodes.overview: Reeling from the showdown on the bridge, Luke teams up with Misty to find Piranha. The hunt for the snitch heats up. Bushmaster reveals his endgame.

episodes.title: If It Ain't Rough, It Ain't Right
episodes.overview: While Shades, Mariah and Misty come to terms with the previous night's events, Bushmaster searches for a way to boost his strength.

episodes.title: For Pete's Sake
episodes.overview: Hunkered down in a makeshift safe house, Luke and Misty butt heads over how to handle Mariah. Meanwhile, long-buried family secrets come to light.

episodes.title: The Main Ingredient
episodes.overview: Danny Rand insists on helping Luke hunt for Bushmaster -- the Iron Fist way. Mariah sets out to reclaim her empire. Misty pursues a traitor.

episodes.title: The Creator
episodes.overview: Shaken by Mariah's latest act, Luke combs the city for a witness. Flashbacks reveal a fateful encounter between the Stokes and McIver families.

episodes.title: Can't Front on Me
episodes.overview: Luke teams up with an unlikely ally to combat a new strain of heroin. As Shades plows ahead with his plan, a massive party draws everyone to the club.

episodes.title: They Reminisce Over You
episodes.overview: Mariah adapts to her new circumstances and goes to extremes to cover her tracks. Luke takes a new approach to protecting Harlem.

data.title: Iron Fist
data.overview: A young man is bestowed with incredible martial arts skills and a mystical force known as the Iron Fist.

episodes.title: Snow Gives Way
episodes.overview: After being presumed dead, Danny Rand returns home to New York after fifteen years, only to find things aren't as they were.

episodes.title: Shadow Hawk Takes Flight
episodes.overview: Danny struggles with his new surroundings, Colleen dishes out a harsh lesson, and Joy sends an unconventional message.

episodes.title: Rolling Thunder Cannon Punch
episodes.overview: Joy proves herself a shrewd businessperson, Danny recalls a painful memory, and Colleen puts her talents to good use.

episodes.title: Eight Diagram Dragon Palm
episodes.overview: Danny makes a shocking discovery and a radical pricing proposal; Colleen's extracurricular activities go viral; Ward issues a stern warning.

episodes.title: Under Leaf Pluck Lotus
episodes.overview: An insidious new drug hits New York. Danny recruits Colleen for the fight, and Claire discovers that credit cards can have many uses.

episodes.title: Immortal Emerges from Cave
episodes.overview: Danny receives an invitation like no other. Colleen and Claire face a difficult choice. A worried Joy confronts her brother.

episodes.title: Felling Tree with Roots
episodes.overview: Ward's loyalty is tested. Danny discovers a rogue division, and the mysterious Bakuto visits Colleen's dojo unannounced.

episodes.title: The Blessing of Many Fractures
episodes.overview: Danny faces his fear, and Colleen meets her match. Joy makes a hasty decision while Ward struggles to accept his sister's admiration.

episodes.title: The Mistress of All Agonies
episodes.overview: Madame Gao plays mind games. Ward's old habits catch up with him, and Danny discovers that he still has much to learn about being the Iron Fist.

episodes.title: Black Tiger Steals Heart
episodes.overview: Exhausted from fighting, Danny tries to recharge with Bakuto's help. Meanwhile, Rand's management gets another shakeup.

episodes.title: Lead Horse Back to Stable
episodes.overview: Claire uses her improvisational skills, and Colleen gets conflicting information. Danny yearns to be more than just a destroyer.

episodes.title: Bar the Big Boss
episodes.overview: Ward receives an offer with strings attached. Davos advocates for an extreme solution and a deadly duel gets personal.

episodes.title: Dragon Plays with Fire
episodes.overview: In a desperate search to clear his name, Danny learns a terrible truth that places him on a new path.

episodes.title: The Fury of Iron Fist
episodes.overview: While rival gangs battle for the soul of New York, Danny and Colleen cross paths with an old acquaintance. Joy embarks on a new adventure.

episodes.title: The City's Not for Burning
episodes.overview: Danny and Colleen strive to broker a badly needed peace. Ward crashes his sister's auction, and Joy plays matchmaker - with a twist

episodes.title: This Deadly Secret...
episodes.overview: In an effort to ease the tension between Ward and Joy, Danny and Colleen switch gears and host a dinner party. Mary delivers a warning.

episodes.title: Target: Iron Fist
episodes.overview: Joy's interrogation of Mary takes a turn. Misty gives Danny an earful. Ward extends an olive branch. Davos makes a crucial discovery.

episodes.title: Heart of the Dragon
episodes.overview: There's a new Iron Fist in town, and he's itching to make his presence felt. Meanwhile, Ward calls in a favor, and Joy considers her options.

episodes.title: The Dragon Dies at Dawn
episodes.overview: Misty and Colleen's trip to the tattoo parlor turns painful -- but not for them. As Davos crosses names off his list, Mary makes Danny an offer.

episodes.title: Morning of the Mindstorm
episodes.overview: As Danny steps up his training, Davos ramps up recruitment. Ward falls prey to old demons, and Misty butts heads with a captain.

episodes.title: Citadel on the Edge of Vengeance
episodes.overview: Joy offers Davos tips on appealing to the masses, Danny begins to understand his limits, and Mary seeks the truth about her past.

episodes.title: War Without End
episodes.overview: Facing a life-changing decision, Danny and Colleen debate their next move. Meanwhile, Davos's contempt for mercy grows stronger.

episodes.title: A Duel of Iron
episodes.overview: In the season finale, Iron Fists collide as the fate of New York City hangs in the balance.

data.title: The Defenders
data.overview: Set a few months after the events of the second season of Daredevil, and a month after the events of Iron Fist, the vigilantes Daredevil, Jessica Jones, Luke Cage, and Iron Fist team up in New York City to fight a common enemy: The Hand.

episodes.title: The H Word
episodes.overview: Matt Murdock, Jessica Jones, Luke Cage and Danny Rand investigate criminals and fight injustice, unaware their paths are about to cross.

episodes.title: Mean Right Hook
episodes.overview: As a new conspiracy takes shape, Matt finds old habits are hard to break, Jessica gets in over her head, Luke tracks a lead, and Danny meets his match.

episodes.title: Worst Behavior
episodes.overview: Elektra's secrets are revealed. Danny changes his tactics. Matt gives Jessica some legal advice. Luke searches for the White Hat.

episodes.title: Royal Dragon
episodes.overview: As the Defenders get to know each other over dinner, they're greeted by a series of party crashers - none of them friendly.

episodes.title: Take Shelter
episodes.overview: Elektra's loyalties are questioned, Colleen clashes with an old acquaintance, and Luke proves he knows how to take a hit.

episodes.title: Ashes, Ashes
episodes.overview: Stick offers up a theory, Danny finds himself sidelined, and Alexandra learns that it's not easy being the leader.

episodes.title: Fish in the Jailhouse
episodes.overview: Matt, Jessica and Luke embark on a desperate search. Colleen and Claire debate heroism. Elektra tries to recruit an all-important ally.

data.title: The Punisher
data.overview: After the murder of his family, Marine veteran Frank Castle becomes the vigilante known as The Punisher with only one goal in mind: to avenge them.

episodes.title: 3 AM
episodes.overview: Former Marine Frank Castle takes the law into his own hands while struggling to come to terms with his traumatic past.

episodes.title: Two Dead Men
episodes.overview: A mysterious phone call forces Frank's hand. Meanwhile, Madani goes digging for suspects and Curtis delivers a message.

episodes.title: Kandahar
episodes.overview: Frank skips the subtlety while interrogating Micro. Brutal memories of top-secret missions shed light on Frank's past.

episodes.title: Resupply
episodes.overview: Madani and Sam plan a delicate operation, Curtis tries to connect with Lewis, and Frank encourages Micro to get his hands dirty.

episodes.title: Gunner
episodes.overview: Frank and Micro go looking for answers from a reluctant witness. Madani and Sam learn of a looming investigation. Rawlins sees a ghost.

episodes.title: The Judas Goat
episodes.overview: With Frank in bad shape, Micro calls on Curtis for help. Madani and Russo continue to mix business with pleasure. Lewis stands up for his rights.

episodes.title: Crosshairs
episodes.overview: Lewis struggles with the ramifications of his actions. Frank and Micro pursue another face from the past. Madani and Sam go bug hunting.

episodes.title: Cold Steel
episodes.overview: Russo opens up to Madani about his past, Sarah shares her concerns about her son with Frank, and a decoy operation takes a turn.

episodes.title: Front Toward Enemy
episodes.overview: Following a deadly explosion, Karen lands in a bomber's crosshairs -- and Frank isn't happy about it. Meanwhile, Curtis makes a grisly discovery.

episodes.title: Virtue of the Vicious
episodes.overview: An attack on a high-profile politician is examined (and reexamined) through different perspectives. Madani faces a painful truth.

episodes.title: Danger Close
episodes.overview: As danger knocks on Sarah's door, Frank takes his quest for vengeance to the next level with some help from an unexpected ally.

episodes.title: Home
episodes.overview: Frank makes a damning confession. A shootout leaves Sarah wondering what to believe. Rawlins goes in for the kill, once and for all.

episodes.title: Memento Mori
episodes.overview: As the authorities close in, an exhausted but unbroken Frank vows to put an end to the war that has consumed his life.

episodes.title: Roadhouse Blues
episodes.overview: While driving through Michigan, Frank stops for a beer at a roadside bar. But staying out of trouble has never been his strong suit.

episodes.title: Fight or Flight
episodes.overview: Frank and a reluctant Rachel go on the run as a menacing adversary gives chase. Meanwhile, Madani pays Russo an unwelcome visit.

episodes.title: Trouble the Water
episodes.overview: As Pilgrim's past comes into focus, Frank and Rachel find themselves in police custody, where they're anything but safe.

episodes.title: Scar Tissue
episodes.overview: Rachel recalls the night everything changed and lets Frank in on the truth about her name. Russo sits down with a face from his childhood.

episodes.title: One-Eyed Jacks
episodes.overview: It's not a trap if you know it's coming: That's Frank's philosophy. Madani opens up and Pilgrim plans a visit to an unholy land.

episodes.title: Nakazat
episodes.overview: Amy (formerly Rachel) develops photographs that point to a conspiracy. Russo reads his own report. Madani's story about Russo comes under fire.

episodes.title: One Bad Day
episodes.overview: Madani's quest to ID Pilgrim hits a wall. Russo and his crew put their plan into action. Frank encounters someone from the past.

episodes.title: My Brother's Keeper
episodes.overview: Painful memories take ahold of Russo. Frank's frustration frightens those closest to him. Madani receives a visitor bearing a warning.

episodes.title: Flustercluck
episodes.overview: A big bounty inspires New York's worst to pursue the Punisher. A restless Amy seeks help from a fellow grifter. Russo and Krista consider the future.

episodes.title: The Dark Hearts of Men
episodes.overview: As Madani and Krista debate who's worth saving, Frank prepares to storm Russo's territory. A brutal encounter pushes Pilgrim back into old habits.

episodes.title: The Abyss
episodes.overview: Amy rushes to protect Frank, who lies defenseless in a hospital. Pilgrim gets some crushing news, and Karen Page calls in a favor.

episodes.title: Collision Course
episodes.overview: Buckle up -- Mahoney and Frank are about to take a ride to remember. Amy makes an entrance, Russo cashes out, and Madani comes clean to Krista.

episodes.title: The Whirlwind
episodes.overview: Frank, Pilgrim, Madani, Russo, Amy, Curt and the Schultz family. No bullet is left unspent as season two comes to an explosive conclusion.

data.title: Moon Knight
data.overview: A former U.S. Marine, struggling with dissociative identity disorder, is granted the powers of an Egyptian moon god. But he soon finds out that these newfound powers can be both a blessing and a curse to his troubled life.

episodes.title: The Goldfish Problem
episodes.overview: Steven Grant learns that he may be a superhero, but may also share a body with a ruthless mercenary.

data.title: Spider-Man: Homecoming
data.overview: Peter Parker balances his life as an ordinary high school student in Queens with his superhero alter-ego Spider-Man, and finds himself on the trail of a new menace prowling the skies of New York City.

data.title: Spider-Man: Far from Home
data.overview: Following the events of Avengers: Endgame (2019), Spider-Man must step up to take on new threats in a world that has changed forever.

data.title: Spider-Man: No Way Home
data.overview: With Spider-Man's identity now revealed, Peter asks Doctor Strange for help. When a spell goes wrong, dangerous foes from other worlds start to appear, forcing Peter to discover what it truly means to be Spider-Man.

data.title: Spider-Man
data.overview: When bitten by a genetically modified spider, a nerdy, shy, and awkward high school student gains spider-like abilities that he eventually must use to fight evil as a superhero after tragedy befalls his family.

data.title: Spider-Man 2
data.overview: Peter Parker is beset with troubles in his failing personal life as he battles a brilliant scientist named Doctor Otto Octavius.

data.title: Spider-Man 3
data.overview: A strange black entity from another world bonds with Peter Parker and causes inner turmoil as he contends with new villains, temptations, and revenge.

data.title: The Amazing Spider-Man
data.overview: After Peter Parker is bitten by a genetically altered spider, he gains newfound, spider-like powers and ventures out to save the city from the machinations of a mysterious reptilian foe.

data.title: The Amazing Spider-Man 2
data.overview: When New York is put under siege by Oscorp, it is up to Spider-Man to save the city he swore to protect as well as his loved ones.

data.title: Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse
data.overview: Teen Miles Morales becomes the Spider-Man of his universe, and must join with five spider-powered individuals from other dimensions to stop a threat for all realities.

data.title: Venom
data.overview: A failed reporter is bonded to an alien entity, one of many symbiotes who have invaded Earth. But the being takes a liking to Earth and decides to protect it.

data.title: Venom: Let There Be Carnage
data.overview: Eddie Brock attempts to reignite his career by interviewing serial killer Cletus Kasady, who becomes the host of the symbiote Carnage and escapes prison after a failed execution.

data.title: Morbius
data.overview: Biochemist Michael Morbius tries to cure himself of a rare blood disease, but he inadvertently infects himself with a form of vampirism instead.

data.title: X-Men
data.overview: In a world where mutants (evolved super-powered humans) exist and are discriminated against, two groups form for an inevitable clash: the supremacist Brotherhood, and the pacifist X-Men.

data.title: X-Men 2
data.overview: When anti-mutant Colonel William Stryker kidnaps Professor X and attacks his school, the X-Men must ally with their archenemy Magneto to stop him.

data.title: X-Men: The Last Stand
data.overview: The human government develops a cure for mutations, and Jean Gray becomes a darker uncontrollable persona called the Phoenix who allies with Magneto, causing escalation into an all-out battle for the X-Men.

data.title: X-Men Origins: Wolverine
data.overview: The early years of James Logan, featuring his rivalry with his brother Victor Creed, his service in the special forces team Weapon X, and his experimentation into the metal-lined mutant Wolverine.

data.title: X-Men: First Class
data.overview: In the 1960s, superpowered humans Charles Xavier and Erik Lensherr work together to find others like them, but Erik's vengeful pursuit of an ambitious mutant who ruined his life causes a schism to divide them.

data.title: The Wolverine
data.overview: Wolverine comes to Japan to meet an old friend whose life he saved years ago, and gets embroiled in a conspiracy involving yakuza and mutants.

data.title: X-Men: Days of Future Past
data.overview: The X-Men send Wolverine to the past in a desperate effort to change history and prevent an event that results in doom for both humans and mutants.

data.title: X-Men: Apocalypse
data.overview: In the 1980s the X-Men must defeat an ancient all-powerful mutant, En Sabah Nur, who intends to thrive through bringing destruction to the world.

data.title: Logan
data.overview: In a future where mutants are nearly extinct, an elderly and weary Logan leads a quiet life. But when Laura, a mutant child pursued by scientists, comes to him for help, he must get her to safety.

data.title: X-Men: Dark Phoenix
data.overview: Jean Grey begins to develop incredible powers that corrupt and turn her into a Dark Phoenix, causing the X-Men to decide if her life is worth more than all of humanity.

data.title: The New Mutants
data.overview: Five young mutants, just discovering their abilities while held in a secret facility against their will, fight to escape their past sins and save themselves.

data.title: Deadpool
data.overview: A wisecracking mercenary gets experimented on and becomes immortal but ugly, and sets out to track down the man who ruined his looks.

data.title: Deadpool 2
data.overview: Foul-mouthed mutant mercenary Wade Wilson (a.k.a. Deadpool) assembles a team of fellow mutant rogues to protect a young boy with supernatural abilities from the brutal, time-traveling cyborg Cable.

data.title: Fantastic Four 2005
data.overview: A group of astronauts gain superpowers after a cosmic radiation exposure and must use them to oppose the plans of their enemy, Doctor Victor Von Doom.

data.title: Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer
data.overview: The Fantastic Four learn that they aren't the only super-powered beings in the universe when they square off against the powerful Silver Surfer and the planet-eating Galactus.

data.title: Fantastic Four 2015
data.overview: Four young outsiders teleport to an alternate and dangerous universe which alters their physical form in shocking ways. The four must learn to harness their new abilities and work together to save Earth from a former friend turned enemy.

data.title: Ghost Rider
data.overview: When motorcycle rider Johnny Blaze sells his soul to the Devil to save his father's life, he is transformed into the Ghost Rider, the Devil's own bounty hunter, and is sent to hunt down sinners.

data.title: Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance
data.overview: Johnny Blaze, tortured by the Ghost Rider's curse, gets a chance of redemption through protecting the Devil's son, whose father is pursuing him.

data.title: Blade
data.overview: A half-vampire, half-mortal man becomes a protector of the mortal race, while slaying evil vampires.

data.title: Blade II
data.overview: Blade forms an uneasy alliance with the vampire council in order to combat the Reapers, who are feeding on vampires.

data.title: Blade: Trinity
data.overview: Blade, now a wanted man by the FBI, must join forces with the Nightstalkers to face his most challenging enemy yet: Dracula.

data.title: Avengers: Endgame
data.overview: After the devastating events of Avengers: Infinity War (2018), the universe is in ruins. With the help of remaining allies, the Avengers assemble once more in order to reverse Thanos' actions and restore balance to the universe.

data.title: Spider-Man: No Way Home
data.overview: With Spider-Man's identity now revealed, Peter asks Doctor Strange for help. When a spell goes wrong, dangerous foes from other worlds start to appear, forcing Peter to discover what it truly means to be Spider-Man.

data.title: Avengers: Infinity War
data.overview: The Avengers and their allies must be willing to sacrifice all in an attempt to defeat the powerful Thanos before his blitz of devastation and ruin puts an end to the universe.

data.title: Guardians of the Galaxy
data.overview: A group of intergalactic criminals must pull together to stop a fanatical warrior with plans to purge the universe.

data.title: Captain America: The Winter Soldier
data.overview: As Steve Rogers struggles to embrace his role in the modern world, he teams up with a fellow Avenger and S.H.I.E.L.D agent, Black Widow, to battle a new threat from history: an assassin known as the Winter Soldier.

data.title: Black Panther
data.overview: T'Challa, heir to the hidden but advanced kingdom of Wakanda, must step forward to lead his people into a new future and must confront a challenger from his country's past.

data.title: Captain America: Civil War
data.overview: Political involvement in the Avengers' affairs causes a rift between Captain America and Iron Man.

data.title: Iron Man
data.overview: After being held captive in an Afghan cave, billionaire engineer Tony Stark creates a unique weaponized suit of armor to fight evil.

data.title: Spider-Man: Homecoming
data.overview: Peter Parker balances his life as an ordinary high school student in Queens with his superhero alter-ego Spider-Man, and finds himself on the trail of a new menace prowling the skies of New York City.

data.title: Thor: Ragnarok
data.overview: Imprisoned on the planet Sakaar, Thor must race against time to return to Asgard and stop Ragnarök, the destruction of his world, at the hands of the powerful and ruthless villain Hela.

data.title: Daredevil
data.overview: A blind lawyer by day, vigilante by night. Matt Murdock fights the crime of New York as Daredevil.”

data.title: Hawkeye
data.overview: Series based on the Marvel Comics superhero Hawkeye, centering on the adventures of Young Avenger, Kate Bishop, who took on the role after the original Avenger, Clint Barton.”

data.title: Loki
data.overview: The mercurial villain Loki resumes his role as the God of Mischief in a new series that takes place after the events of “Avengers: Endgame.”

data.title: WandaVision
data.overview: Blends the style of classic sitcoms with the MCU, in which Wanda Maximoff and Vision - two super-powered beings living their ideal suburban lives - begin to suspect that everything is not as it seems.

data.title: The Falcon and the Winter Soldier
data.overview: Following the events of 'Avengers: Endgame,' Sam Wilson/Falcon and Bucky Barnes/Winter Soldier team up in a global adventure that tests their abilities -- and their patience.

data.title: Luke Cage
data.overview: When a sabotaged experiment gives him super strength and unbreakable skin, Luke Cage becomes a fugitive attempting to rebuild his life in Harlem and must soon confront his past and fight a battle for the heart of his city.

data.title: Jessica Jones
data.overview: Following the tragic end of her brief superhero career, Jessica Jones tries to rebuild her life as a private investigator, dealing with cases involving people with remarkable abilities in New York City.

data.title: The Defenders
data.overview: Set a few months after the events of the second season of Daredevil, and a month after the events of Iron Fist, the vigilantes Daredevil, Jessica Jones, Luke Cage, and Iron Fist team up in New York City to fight a common enemy: The Hand.

data.title: The Punisher
data.overview: After the murder of his family, Marine veteran Frank Castle becomes the vigilante known as The Punisher with only one goal in mind: to avenge them.

data.title: Iron Fist
data.overview: A young man is bestowed with incredible martial arts skills and a mystical force known as the Iron Fist.

data.title: Iron Man
data.overview: After being held captive in an Afghan cave, billionaire engineer Tony Stark creates a unique weaponized suit of armor to fight evil.

data.title: The Incredible Hulk
data.overview: Bruce Banner, a scientist on the run from the U.S. Government, must find a cure for the monster he turns into whenever he loses his temper.

data.title: Iron Man 2
data.overview: With the world now aware of his identity as Iron Man, Tony Stark must contend with both his declining health and a vengeful mad man with ties to his father's legacy.

data.title: Thor
data.overview: The powerful but arrogant god Thor is cast out of Asgard to live amongst humans in Midgard (Earth), where he soon becomes one of their finest defenders.

data.title: Captain America: The First Avenger
data.overview: Steve Rogers, a rejected military soldier, transforms into Captain America after taking a dose of a Super-Soldier serum. But being Captain America comes at a price as he attempts to take down a war monger and a terrorist organization.

data.title: The Avengers
data.overview: Earth's mightiest heroes must come together and learn to fight as a team if they are going to stop the mischievous Loki and his alien army from enslaving humanity.

data.title: Iron Man 3
data.overview: When Tony Stark's world is torn apart by a formidable terrorist called the Mandarin, he starts an odyssey of rebuilding and retribution.

data.title: Thor: The Dark World
data.overview: When the Dark Elves attempt to plunge the universe into darkness, Thor must embark on a perilous and personal journey that will reunite him with doctor Jane Foster.

data.title: Captain America: The Winter Soldier
data.overview: As Steve Rogers struggles to embrace his role in the modern world, he teams up with a fellow Avenger and S.H.I.E.L.D agent, Black Widow, to battle a new threat from history: an assassin known as the Winter Soldier.

data.title: Guardians of the Galaxy
data.overview: A group of intergalactic criminals must pull together to stop a fanatical warrior with plans to purge the universe.

data.title: Avengers: Age of Ultron
data.overview: When Tony Stark and Bruce Banner try to jump-start a dormant peacekeeping program called Ultron, things go horribly wrong and it's up to Earth's mightiest heroes to stop the villainous Ultron from enacting his terrible plan.

data.title: Ant-Man
data.overview: Armed with a super-suit with the astonishing ability to shrink in scale but increase in strength, cat burglar Scott Lang must embrace his inner hero and help his mentor, Dr. Hank Pym, pull off a plan that will save the world.

data.title: Captain America: Civil War
data.overview: Political involvement in the Avengers' affairs causes a rift between Captain America and Iron Man.

data.title: Doctor Strange
data.overview: While on a journey of physical and spiritual healing, a brilliant neurosurgeon is drawn into the world of the mystic arts.

data.title: Guardians of the Galaxy: Vol. 2
data.overview: The Guardians struggle to keep together as a team while dealing with their personal family issues, notably Star-Lord's encounter with his father the ambitious celestial being Ego.

data.title: Thor: Ragnarok
data.overview: Imprisoned on the planet Sakaar, Thor must race against time to return to Asgard and stop Ragnarök, the destruction of his world, at the hands of the powerful and ruthless villain Hela.

data.title: Black Panther
data.overview: T'Challa, heir to the hidden but advanced kingdom of Wakanda, must step forward to lead his people into a new future and must confront a challenger from his country's past.

data.title: Avengers: Infinity War
data.overview: The Avengers and their allies must be willing to sacrifice all in an attempt to defeat the powerful Thanos before his blitz of devastation and ruin puts an end to the universe.

data.title: Ant-Man and the Wasp
data.overview: As Scott Lang balances being both a superhero and a father, Hope van Dyne and Dr. Hank Pym present an urgent new mission that finds the Ant-Man fighting alongside The Wasp to uncover secrets from their past.

data.title: Captain Marvel
data.overview: Carol Danvers becomes one of the universe's most powerful heroes when Earth is caught in the middle of a galactic war between two alien races.

data.title: Avengers: Endgame
data.overview: After the devastating events of Avengers: Infinity War (2018), the universe is in ruins. With the help of remaining allies, the Avengers assemble once more in order to reverse Thanos' actions and restore balance to the universe.

data.title: Black Widow
data.overview: Natasha Romanoff confronts the darker parts of her ledger when a dangerous conspiracy with ties to her past arises.

data.title: Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings
data.overview: Shang-Chi, the master of weaponry-based Kung Fu, is forced to confront his past after being drawn into the Ten Rings organization.

data.title: Eternals
data.overview: The saga of the Eternals, a race of immortal beings who lived on Earth and shaped its history and civilizations.

data.title: Spider-Man: Homecoming
data.overview: Peter Parker balances his life as an ordinary high school student in Queens with his superhero alter-ego Spider-Man, and finds himself on the trail of a new menace prowling the skies of New York City.

data.title: Spider-Man: Far from Home
data.overview: Following the events of Avengers: Endgame (2019), Spider-Man must step up to take on new threats in a world that has changed forever.

data.title: Spider-Man: No Way Home
data.overview: With Spider-Man's identity now revealed, Peter asks Doctor Strange for help. When a spell goes wrong, dangerous foes from other worlds start to appear, forcing Peter to discover what it truly means to be Spider-Man.

data.title: Spider-Man
data.overview: When bitten by a genetically modified spider, a nerdy, shy, and awkward high school student gains spider-like abilities that he eventually must use to fight evil as a superhero after tragedy befalls his family.

data.title: Spider-Man 2
data.overview: Peter Parker is beset with troubles in his failing personal life as he battles a brilliant scientist named Doctor Otto Octavius.

data.title: Spider-Man 3
data.overview: A strange black entity from another world bonds with Peter Parker and causes inner turmoil as he contends with new villains, temptations, and revenge.

data.title: The Amazing Spider-Man
data.overview: After Peter Parker is bitten by a genetically altered spider, he gains newfound, spider-like powers and ventures out to save the city from the machinations of a mysterious reptilian foe.

data.title: The Amazing Spider-Man 2
data.overview: When New York is put under siege by Oscorp, it is up to Spider-Man to save the city he swore to protect as well as his loved ones.

data.title: Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse
data.overview: Teen Miles Morales becomes the Spider-Man of his universe, and must join with five spider-powered individuals from other dimensions to stop a threat for all realities.

data.title: Venom
data.overview: A failed reporter is bonded to an alien entity, one of many symbiotes who have invaded Earth. But the being takes a liking to Earth and decides to protect it.

data.title: Venom: Let There Be Carnage
data.overview: Eddie Brock attempts to reignite his career by interviewing serial killer Cletus Kasady, who becomes the host of the symbiote Carnage and escapes prison after a failed execution.

data.title: Morbius
data.overview: Biochemist Michael Morbius tries to cure himself of a rare blood disease, but he inadvertently infects himself with a form of vampirism instead.

data.title: X-Men
data.overview: In a world where mutants (evolved super-powered humans) exist and are discriminated against, two groups form for an inevitable clash: the supremacist Brotherhood, and the pacifist X-Men.

data.title: X-Men 2
data.overview: When anti-mutant Colonel William Stryker kidnaps Professor X and attacks his school, the X-Men must ally with their archenemy Magneto to stop him.

data.title: X-Men: The Last Stand
data.overview: The human government develops a cure for mutations, and Jean Gray becomes a darker uncontrollable persona called the Phoenix who allies with Magneto, causing escalation into an all-out battle for the X-Men.

data.title: X-Men Origins: Wolverine
data.overview: The early years of James Logan, featuring his rivalry with his brother Victor Creed, his service in the special forces team Weapon X, and his experimentation into the metal-lined mutant Wolverine.

data.title: X-Men: First Class
data.overview: In the 1960s, superpowered humans Charles Xavier and Erik Lensherr work together to find others like them, but Erik's vengeful pursuit of an ambitious mutant who ruined his life causes a schism to divide them.

data.title: The Wolverine
data.overview: Wolverine comes to Japan to meet an old friend whose life he saved years ago, and gets embroiled in a conspiracy involving yakuza and mutants.

data.title: X-Men: Days of Future Past
data.overview: The X-Men send Wolverine to the past in a desperate effort to change history and prevent an event that results in doom for both humans and mutants.

data.title: X-Men: Apocalypse
data.overview: In the 1980s the X-Men must defeat an ancient all-powerful mutant, En Sabah Nur, who intends to thrive through bringing destruction to the world.

data.title: Logan
data.overview: In a future where mutants are nearly extinct, an elderly and weary Logan leads a quiet life. But when Laura, a mutant child pursued by scientists, comes to him for help, he must get her to safety.

data.title: X-Men: Dark Phoenix
data.overview: Jean Grey begins to develop incredible powers that corrupt and turn her into a Dark Phoenix, causing the X-Men to decide if her life is worth more than all of humanity.

data.title: The New Mutants
data.overview: Five young mutants, just discovering their abilities while held in a secret facility against their will, fight to escape their past sins and save themselves.

data.title: Deadpool
data.overview: A wisecracking mercenary gets experimented on and becomes immortal but ugly, and sets out to track down the man who ruined his looks.

data.title: Deadpool 2
data.overview: Foul-mouthed mutant mercenary Wade Wilson (a.k.a. Deadpool) assembles a team of fellow mutant rogues to protect a young boy with supernatural abilities from the brutal, time-traveling cyborg Cable.

data.title: Fantastic Four 2005
data.overview: A group of astronauts gain superpowers after a cosmic radiation exposure and must use them to oppose the plans of their enemy, Doctor Victor Von Doom.

data.title: Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer
data.overview: The Fantastic Four learn that they aren't the only super-powered beings in the universe when they square off against the powerful Silver Surfer and the planet-eating Galactus.

data.title: Fantastic Four 2015
data.overview: Four young outsiders teleport to an alternate and dangerous universe which alters their physical form in shocking ways. The four must learn to harness their new abilities and work together to save Earth from a former friend turned enemy.

data.title: Ghost Rider
data.overview: When motorcycle rider Johnny Blaze sells his soul to the Devil to save his father's life, he is transformed into the Ghost Rider, the Devil's own bounty hunter, and is sent to hunt down sinners.

data.title: Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance
data.overview: Johnny Blaze, tortured by the Ghost Rider's curse, gets a chance of redemption through protecting the Devil's son, whose father is pursuing him.

data.title: Blade
data.overview: A half-vampire, half-mortal man becomes a protector of the mortal race, while slaying evil vampires.

data.title: Blade II
data.overview: Blade forms an uneasy alliance with the vampire council in order to combat the Reapers, who are feeding on vampires.

data.title: Blade: Trinity
data.overview: Blade, now a wanted man by the FBI, must join forces with the Nightstalkers to face his most challenging enemy yet: Dracula.

data.title: Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness
data.overview: Doctor Strange teams up with a mysterious teenage girl from his dreams who can travel across multiverses, to battle multiple threats, including other-universe versions of himself, which threaten to wipe out millions across the multiverse. They seek help from Wanda the Scarlet Witch, Wong and others.

data.title: Thor: Love and Thunder
data.overview: Thor enlists the help of Valkyrie, Korg and ex-girlfriend Jane Foster to fight Gorr the God Butcher, who intends to make the gods extinct.

data.title: Black Panther: Wakanda Forever
data.overview: The nation of Wakanda is pitted against intervening world powers as they mourn the loss of their king T'Challa.

data.title: WandaVision
data.overview: Blends the style of classic sitcoms with the MCU, in which Wanda Maximoff and Vision - two super-powered beings living their ideal suburban lives - begin to suspect that everything is not as it seems.

episodes.title: Filmed Before a Live Studio Audience
episodes.overview: Wanda and Vision struggle to conceal their powers during dinner with Vision's boss and his wife.

episodes.title: Don't Touch That Dial
episodes.overview: In an effort to fit in, Wanda and Vision perform a magic act in their community talent show.

episodes.title: Now in Color
episodes.overview: Wanda's pregnancy fritzes her powers as she and Vision prepare for an accelerated delivery.

episodes.title: We Interrupt This Program
episodes.overview: Monica Rambeau, tasked with a special assignment regarding sentient weapons, goes missing.

episodes.title: On a Very Special Episode...
episodes.overview: Wanda addresses Vision's worries when he grows suspicious of the neighbors' strange behaviour.

episodes.title: All-New Halloween Spooktacular!
episodes.overview: Disturbances on Halloween separate Wanda from Vision, who looks into anomalous activity in Westview.

episodes.title: Breaking the Fourth Wall
episodes.overview: Monica plots her return, Wanda navigates unsettling complications, and Vision forms a new alliance.

episodes.title: Previously On
episodes.overview: Wanda embarks on a troubling journey revisiting her past for insight into her present and future.

episodes.title: The Series Finale
episodes.overview: Wanda battles Agatha and Vision fights his S.W.O.R.D. counterpart as Hayward launches an attack on Westview.

data.title: The Falcon and the Winter Soldier
data.overview: Following the events of 'Avengers: Endgame,' Sam Wilson/Falcon and Bucky Barnes/Winter Soldier team up in a global adventure that tests their abilities -- and their patience.

episodes.title: New World Order
episodes.overview: Sam Wilson and Bucky Barnes realize that their futures are anything but normal.

episodes.title: The Star-Spangled Man
episodes.overview: John Walker is named Captain America, and Sam Wilson and Bucky Barnes team up against the rebel group the Flag Smashers.

episodes.title: Power Broker
episodes.overview: To find the source of the Super Soldier Serum, Sam and Bucky must scale a ladder of low-lifes starting in Madripoor with Zemo.

episodes.title: The Whole World Is Watching
episodes.overview: John Walker loses patience with Sam and Bucky as they learn more about Karli Morgenthau.

episodes.title: Truth
episodes.overview: Sam Wilson, Bucky Barnes, Baron Zemo, John Walker, and Karli Morgenthau must all deal with the fall out from their actions.

episodes.title: One World, One People
episodes.overview: As the Flag Smashers escalate their efforts, Sam and Bucky take action.

data.title: Loki
data.overview: The mercurial villain Loki resumes his role as the God of Mischief in a new series that takes place after the events of “Avengers: Endgame.”

episodes.title: Glorious Purpose
episodes.overview: Loki, the God of Mischief, finds himself out of time and in an unusual place and forced - against his godly disposition - to cooperate with others.

episodes.title: The Variant
episodes.overview: Mobius puts Loki to work, but not everyone at TVA is thrilled about the God of Mischief's presence.

episodes.title: Lamentis
episodes.overview: Loki finds out The Variant's plan, but he has his own that will forever alter both their destinies.

episodes.title: The Nexus Event
episodes.overview: Frayed nerves and paranoia infiltrate the TVA as Mobius and Hunter B-15 search for Loki and Sylvie.

episodes.title: Journey Into Mystery
episodes.overview: Loki tries to escape The Void, a desolate purgatory where he meets variant versions of himself.

episodes.title: For All Time. Always.
episodes.overview: The clock is ticking in the season finale which finds Loki and Sylvie on a date with destiny.

data.title: What If
data.overview: Exploring pivotal moments from the Marvel Cinematic Universe and turning them on their head, leading the audience into uncharted territory.

episodes.title: What If... Captain Carter Were the First Avenger?
episodes.overview: When Steve Rogers is seriously injured, Peggy Carter becomes the world's first super soldier.

episodes.title: What If... T'Challa Became a Star-Lord?
episodes.overview: The rough-and-tumble space pirates known as the Ravagers abduct T'Challa instead of Peter Quill.

episodes.title: What If... The World Lost Its Mightiest Heroes?
episodes.overview: Nick Fury struggles to launch The Avengers when candidates are targeted by a serial killer.

episodes.title: What If... Doctor Strange Lost His Heart Instead of His Hands?
episodes.overview: A grief-stricken Doctor Strange uses the Eye of Agamotto in a dangerous effort to change the past.

episodes.title: What If... Zombies?!
episodes.overview: When The Avengers are infected by a zombie plague, surviving heroes search for a cure.

episodes.title: What If... Killmonger Rescued Tony Stark?
episodes.overview: Killmonger rescues Tony Stark when his Humvee is attacked in Afghanistan and manipulates his influence for his designs of conquering Wakanda.

episodes.title: What If... Thor Were an Only Child?
episodes.overview: Thor, who never learned to be a good hero, throws an out-of-control intergalactic party on Earth.

episodes.title: What If... Ultron Won?
episodes.overview: Natasha Romanoff and Clint Barton seek to destroy killer-robot Ultron following a cataclysmic event.

episodes.title: What If... The Watcher Broke His Oath?
episodes.overview: The Watcher gathers heroes from across the multiverse for one final battle against Infinity Ultron.

data.title: Hawkeye
data.overview: Series based on the Marvel Comics superhero Hawkeye, centering on the adventures of Young Avenger, Kate Bishop, who took on the role after the original Avenger, Clint Barton.”

episodes.title: Never Meet Your Heroes
episodes.overview: Archer Kate Bishop lands in the middle of a criminal conspiracy, forcing Hawkeye out of retirement.

episodes.title: Hide and Seek
episodes.overview: Clint has to help Kate disentangle herself from the Tracksuit Mafia and a real-life murder mystery.

episodes.title: Echoes
episodes.overview: After escaping a new threat, Clint and Kate join forces against an expanding criminal conspiracy.

episodes.title: Partners, Am I Right?
episodes.overview: Secrets are revealed and hard truths emerge, culminating in a battle against two opposing forces.

episodes.title: Ronin
episodes.overview: A fallout nearly derails their partnership, but Kate makes a discovery that changes everything.

episodes.title: So This Is Christmas?
episodes.overview: Clint and Kate's partnership is tested as they face the consequences of exposing the conspiracy.

data.title: Daredevil
data.overview: A blind lawyer by day, vigilante by night. Matt Murdock fights the crime of New York as Daredevil.”

episodes.title: Into the Ring
episodes.overview: Matt Murdock and Foggy Nelson open their law firm, and take the case of a woman accused of murder who Matt believes is innocent.

episodes.title: Cut Man
episodes.overview: Murdock makes a near fatal error while trying to save a kidnapped boy, and finds an unlikely ally when he needs saving himself.

episodes.title: Rabbit in a Snowstorm
episodes.overview: Murdock and Foggy take on a mysterious wealthy client, but Murdock is convinced that there's more to the case than just the facts.

episodes.title: In the Blood
episodes.overview: Two vicious Russian brothers working for Fisk strike back against Daredevil. Fisk moves to further consolidate his power in the criminal underworld.

episodes.title: World on Fire
